page.title: 17THE OLD RECTORY, CHILMARK
page.content: This remarkable house, known sometimes as the{Park,}lies hidden by old beech trees, between the village street and the main road. The{original house, much added to, is built of local {limestone}and is{contemporary}with the church, that is{14th century.}A whole network of underground culverts and alleged passages carries away flood water and links the house with the churchyard. One of the bedrooms oi the old part has a splendid stone fireplace decorated with metal roses, dated 15th century. Many of the original mullioned windows are intact. During the{19th century}an incumbent with ten children built on a red brick extension, Georgian in style, including a third staircase and a magnificent drawing room. It is this contrast in styles and materials which give the house its character. AMcG
